availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James P. Gay (Clark County, Kentucky, farmer. )

body.p:
Clark County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Benjamin P. Gay and Mary Gay.
Married to Mary Gay. Married to Harriet Miller Gay in Winchester, Clark County on February 5, 1861. Father of Benjamin P. Gay and James Gay. Farmer in Clark County in 1850. Household owned twenty-five enslaved persons in Clark County in 1850. Farmer in Clark County in 1860. Held four enslaved persons in trust for Lewis Gay in Clark County in 1860. Held an additional eight enslaved persons in trust for Mary E. Goff in Clark County in 1860. Hired an additional five enslaved persons in Clark County in 1860.
